data.title: I’m in! Grumpy Dragon leads march of the makers
data.meta_description: Cards on the table, I have never understood the pulling power of BBC2’s Dragons’ Den.  Its entrepreneur stars are clearly preening egomaniacs, the entrants asking for money are plainly chosen for
data.text:
Cards on the table, I have never understood the pulling power of BBC2’s Dragons’ Den.

Its entrepreneur stars are clearly preening egomaniacs, the entrants asking for money are plainly chosen for daftness, and the presenter, Evan Davis, must be enjoying the longest smirk in television history.

Let’s not even discuss the message in the cash crassly piled beside each Dragon in the television studio. What help is all this to anyone starting a business?

“Well,” says Deborah Meaden, refusing to be riled, “it shows there are things you should know — like what your turnover is.”

Oh, please. With the show now in its 10th series, you would think entrants might have worked that out. Meaden, 53, who has starred since 2006 as Grumpy Dragon
